thread.title: 'Personal reasons'? Ovechkin benched for sleeping in
thread.title_full: 'Personal reasons'? Ovechkin benched for sleeping in

title: 'Personal reasons'? Ovechkin benched for sleeping in
text:
By Mike Zeisberger , Toronto Sun First posted: Wednesday, October 14, 2015 12:54 PM EDT | Updated: Wednesday, October 14, 2015 01:00 PM EDT 
If you snooze, you lose. 
Even if your name is Alex Ovechkin. 
When the Capitals claimed The Great Eight was kept out of the lineup in Tuesday’s 5-0 loss to the San Jose Sharks for “personal reasons,” it turned out that the cause was that he overslept and was late for the team’s morning skate. 
According to Ovechkin, he’d set his alarm for 8:30 p.m., not 8:30 a.m. 
Whatever the case, coach Barry Trotz found sufficient grounds to bench him. 
“It was an honest mistake,” Trotz told reporters Wednesday. “We have certain accountability rules.” 
For the record, Ovechkin was on the ice for practice Wednesday before meeting with the media. 
“What time did you wake up?” Ovechkin was asked by a reporter. 
“Maybe you should ask what time I went to bed?” he replied. 
Maybe not. 
Ovechkin did say missing the Sharks game “sucked.” Top stories
